sentences.sContent: ...In its latest update on global employment trends...
...The director general of the International Labor Organization Juan Somavia notes that some countries have taken measures to address the effects of the global crisis...
...Somavia says the International Labor Organization is proposing a global jobs' agreement to deal with unemployment...
...The article cites the global giant Procter & Gamble as an example...
...The burger business faces more pressure from regulators at a time when it is already adapting strategies inresponse to shifts in the global economy...
...smaller fast-food chains in America have been hit particularly hard in this downturn because they are competing with the global giant McDonald's...

...Parents and students who have invested heavily in higher education worry about graduates' job prospects as technological advances and changes in domestic and global markets transform professions in ways that reduce wages and cut jobs...
...our goal must be to respect differences among people in order to get along successfully with our global neighbors...
...Scientists are in　general agreement that the warmer conditions we have been experiencing are at least in part the result of a human-induced global warming trend...
...Since then it has evolved into a global crisis...

phrases.pCn: n. 全球环境；地球环境
全球变化；全世界性变化
全局稳定性；整体稳定性；大范围稳定

remMethod.val: 来自globe(n. 地球， 世界)

trans.tranCn: 全球的， 全世界的； 总的， 完整的
trans.tranOther: affecting or including the whole world
